SENT.plain: The diagnosis of Barrett's oesophagus has traditionally relied on the identification of a 3-cm segment of endoscopically abnormal epithelium (columnar) in the distal oesophagus
More recently, the presence of intestinal metaplasia has become essential
The importance of the definition relates to the identification of the risk of cancer development
These factors are discussed in the context of the rising incidence of adenocarcinoma, and the relative contributions of endoscopists and pathologists in determining likely progression are explored
We also discuss the advances in endoscopic technology that may aid the endoscopist in predicting malignant progression
